name: Atlanta Marriott Suites Midtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights at the end of April 2007, named $85/night on priceline! Stayed in a corner suite, the room was pleasantly larger than we expected. Within walking distance to the Botanical Gardens. Getting into the parking garage is a bit of a challenge going down the steep ramp and having to stop and swipe your room card. We figured out it's easiest to have the passenger get out and swipe the card, then the driver doesn't need to put the car in park to lean out the door to swipe.
reviews.title: Saved by booking on Priceline!

reviews.text: The Atlanta Marriott Suites is a classy place. The hotel staff was all very friendly. A request for a late check out was approved with no hassle. The room and the whole hotel was clean. The suite aspect - one room with a sofa, desk and TV, another bedroom with another TV is very nice. This is a busy part of town, but the street noise did not intrude into the room much. All in all, a very nice hotel.
reviews.title: A class act

likes.disliked: — Extra charges for internet & not enough TV channels

reviews.text: It IS on the pricey side though, and you need to beware of the extra charges. There is an extra $16 per day to park. There is no breakfast included, and the onsite hotel restaurant is expensive. There is also an extra charge for Internet access.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel
Wonderful Experience!!
reviews.text: And in a hotel of this calibre/price - why don't they have more TV channels? I think there were approx 30 channels only - I get way more at home and there was no HGTV!! :-(

The hotel was very nice and the staff was very friendly. Everything was very clean and the hotel is in a great area. There are plenty of restaurants, bars and shopping nearby. It is extremely easy to access from the interstate. We had a slight billing problem (which was a simple mistake & has since been taken care of), so just make sure your final bill is correct before you check out. Enjoy your stay!
reviews.title: Good Value for Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed a Thurs and Friday night. Rate included breakfast and parking. Paying for parking and/or breakfast would have been kind of expensive, but not unusual for a "downtown-ish" hotel.
reviews.title: Nice Midtown stay

reviews.text: All suites, nice room. It has the great Marriott updated bedding.
reviews.title: Cheaper than the Four Seasons but you get what you pay for

reviews.text: Internet access in the room is not free. I've come to expect free internet access, but I realize that many of the bigger markets do not offer it free...because they can apparently charge for it.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, worth a look

reviews.text: 1.5 blocks from MARTA-Arts Center Station. One block from Crescent St which has plenty of dining options within walking distance. Easy MARTA ride to downtown for business or tourist stuff.
reviews.title: Nice, good location
Okay, but it could improve...
reviews.text: Right next door to Four Seasons. Einsteins Bagels and Starbucks next door for coffee/breakfast options.

Very nice, large, clean rooms, good rates, quiet location. Near the Marta but not near anything else (i.e. restaurants). Restaurant service is spotty, pleasant but slow. Room service was even worse, waited 2 hours before giving up. Was told 1 hour into it that the food was ready but was waiting for someone to bring it up.
reviews.title: Very good, but with exceptions

reviews.text: Staff was very pleasant even with the slow service.
reviews.title: Big rooms, great location

reviews.text: Probably worth a revisit.
reviews.title: Find a Nicer Hotel For The Rate

reviews.text: We stayed for 1 night during the week. Really easy to get to from Marta. The bedroom, living room, and bathroom area was very big. There was an empty mini fridge in the bar area. An added bonus was an outdoor balcony. It was very quiet, even though we were in the middle of the city. The location was great for nightlife, can't get much better. If you have a couple of nights to spend in Atlanta, and don't want to rent a car, this is a great place to stay. We plan on going back and getting ajoining suites with a group of friends. It would be like having our own apartment in midtown.
reviews.title: Great hotel stay in midtown ATL

reviews.text: This hotel is VERY basic. For the nightly rate there are MUCH nicer hotels in the Midtown Area.
reviews.title: Clean but needs renovation

likes.liked: — Clean and quiet room, friendly staff
likes.disliked: — Outdated room decor and bathroom, shalow pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I wanted a hotel in mid-town Atlanta that offered the best combination of location, a suite instead of just a standard room, price and amenities. I looked around quite a bit and ended up selecting this Marriott. For about $155 a night it offered a package including an upgraded 1-br suite with separate living room, and it included free parking, breakfast, and $50 worth of gift cards to Atlantic Station (large new retail district about 5 minute drive away).
reviews.title: Great Service

likes.liked: — Large suite, very good value, excellent service.

reviews.text: That's a very good deal, price-wise. There were cheaper rooms at other good hotels (we could have had a standard room at W just up the street for the same price), but none of them had the parking/breakfast/shopping deal, and those things add up.
reviews.title: Nice Place, Conveniently Located

reviews.text: The hotel itself was fine, not top-notch, but very good and perfectly comfortable. The bed was great, the bathroom was huge (with separate tub and shower). The room was quiet.
reviews.title: Great Hotel!

reviews.text: The service was excellent. Everyone we encountered was extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet (free with our package) was very good.
reviews.title: Nice, Convenient for the Price
Good Hotel, No Wireless!!!!
reviews.text: The location was convenient to everything from Turner Field for a baseball game (10 minute drive) to mid-town attractions like the Botanical Gardens (less than 10 minutes), etc. Very easy to get around.

reviews.title: Amazing!!
reviews.text: In any event, chose the hotel because of the big rooms, pool and location, and wasn't disappointed on any count. The rooms feel more like a small apartment, given the fact there is a living room and smallish kitchen. I didn't actually use the pool, but had a look and it's fine. The location is within walking distance of several very good bars and restaurants, or within easy driving distance of the best Atlanta has to offer for dining and nightlife.

reviews.title: Very comfortable
reviews.text: It's definitely not the flashiest place around. If you want that, stay next door at the Four Seasons or down the road at the W. If you stay here, you'll have to be content with lots of dark wood and brass knobs. But that aside, the above and good service win the day here.
This hotel was the best! good service, very freindly, and was overall a 5 STAR!
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised!

likes.disliked: — The daily fees for internet use - $12.95 daily.

reviews.title: Great location, very clean and family friendly
reviews.text: I stayed here only one night but was very impressed. This is a very comfortable hotel in an excellent locaion near MARTA rail service. Easy check in, convenient parking, and a large, clean room with a comfortable bed. My only complaint would be that the 3rd floor room in the middle of the hotel had almost no view to speak of. I paid $75 on Priceline, so the price could not have been much better either.

description: They say location is everything ... we have that and much more. Located in the Heart of Midtown (Atlanta's corporate & cultural center), the Marriott Suites Midtown caters to every guest. Whether traveling for business or pleasure, you can trust that all your expectaions will be exceeded. The Marriott Suites Midtown is within easy walking distance of museaums, theatres, nightlife (Crescent Avenue) and our city's finest restaurants, as well as the Arts Center MARTA station (Atlanta's rapid rail systm). We offer 254 spacious suites, each with a seperate living room, bedroom (with either 1 king or 2 double beds), oversized bathrooms with seperate tub & shower, voice mail, indoor/outdor pool, and 24-hour fitness center. We also offer Room Service and our own restaurant & lounge (Grille 35), open for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner daily. The Marriott Midtown Suites embraces its roots in the finest in hospitality, Southern Style of course!
